API¶

class aioftp.Client(create_connection=None)¶

Bases: aioftp.client.BaseClient

FTP client.

Parameters:create_connection (callable()) – factory for creating connection. Using default asyncio.BaseEventLoop.create_connection() if omitted.
change_directory(path='..')¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Change current directory. Goes «up» if no parameters passed.

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – new directory, goes «up» if omitted
check_codes(expected_codes, received_code, info)¶

Checks if any of expected matches received.

Parameters:
  • expected_codes (tuple) – tuple of expected codes
  • received_code (aioftp.Code) – received code for matching
  • info (list) – list of response lines from server
Raises aioftp.StatusCodeError:
 

if received code does not matches any expected code
close()¶

Close connection.

command(command=None, expected_codes=(), wait_codes=())¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Basic command logic.

  1. Send command if not omitted.
  2. Yield response until no wait code matches.
  3. Check code for expected.
Parameters:
  • command (str) – command line
  • expected_codes (tuple) – tuple of expected codes
  • wait_codes (tuple) – tuple of wait codes
connect(host, port=21)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Connect to server.

Parameters:
  • host (str) – host name for connection
  • port (int) – port number for connection
download(source, destination='', *, write_into=False, callback=None, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

High level download method for downloading files and directories recursively and save them to the file system.

Parameters:
  • source (str or pathlib.Path) – source path of file or directory on server side
  • destination (str or pathlib.Path) – destination path of file or directory on client side
  • write_into (bool) – write source into destination (if you want download file and change it name, as well with directories)
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — received bytes from server. This one should be used only for progress view, cause there is no information about which file this bytes really belongs.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
download_file(source, *, callback, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Low level download method for downloading file without saving.

Parameters:
  • source (str or pathlib.Path) – source path of file or directory on server side
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — received bytes from server.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
exists(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Check path for existence.

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – path for checking on server side
Return type:bool
get_current_directory()¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Getting current working directory.

Return type:pathlib.Path
get_passive_connection(conn_type='I')¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Getting pair of reader, writer for passive connection with server.

Parameters:conn_type (str) – connection type (“I”, “A”, “E”, “L”)
Return type:(asyncio.StreamReader, asyncio.StreamWriter)
is_dir(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Checks if path is dir.

Return type:bool
is_file(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Checks if path is file.

Return type:bool
list(path='', *, recursive=False, callback=None)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

List all files and directories in “path”.

Parameters:
  • path (str or pathlib.Path) – directory or file path
  • recursive (bool) – list recursively
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with two arguments: path and stats
Return type:

list or None
login(user='anonymous', password='anon@', account='')¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Server authentication.

Parameters:
  • user (str) – username
  • password (str) – password
  • account (str) – account (almost always blank)
Raises aioftp.StatusCodeError:
 

if unknown code received
make_directory(path, *, parents=True)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Make directory.

Parameters:
  • path (str or pathlib.Path) – path to directory to create
  • parents (bool) – create parents if does not exists
parse_address_response(s)¶

Parsing ip:port server response.

Parameters:s (str) – response line
Returns:(ip, port)
Return type:(str, int)
parse_directory_response(s)¶

Parsing directory server response.

Parameters:s (str) – response line
Return type:pathlib.Path
parse_line()¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Parsing server response line.

Returns:(code, line)
Return type:(aioftp.Code, str)
parse_mlsx_line(b)¶

Parsing MLS(T|D) response.

Parameters:b (bytes or str) – response line
Returns:(path, info)
Return type:(pathlib.Path, dict)
parse_response()¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Parsing full server response (all lines).

Returns:(code, lines)
Return type:(aioftp.Code, list of str)
Raises aioftp.StatusCodeError:
 if received code does not matches all already received codes
quit()¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Send “QUIT” and close connection.

remove(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

High level remove method for removing path recursively (file or directory).

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – path to remove
remove_directory(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Low level remove method for removing empty directory.

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – empty directory to remove
remove_file(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Low level remove method for removing file.

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – file to remove
rename(source, destination)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Rename (move) file or directory.

Parameters:
  • source (str or pathlib.Path) – path to rename
  • destination (str or pathlib.Path) – path new name
retrieve(*command_args, conn_type='I', use_lines=False, callback=None, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Retrieve data from passive connection with some command

Parameters:
  • command_args – arguments for aioftp.Client.command()
  • conn_type (str) – connection type (“I”, “A”, “E”, “L”)
  • use_lines (bool) – use lines or block size for read
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — received bytes from server.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
stat(path)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Getting path stats.

Parameters:path (str or pathlib.Path) – path for getting info
Returns:path info
Return type:dict
store(*command_args, file, conn_type='I', use_lines=False, callback=None, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Store data to passive connection with some command

Parameters:
  • command_args – arguments for aioftp.Client.command()
  • file – file-like object for reading data (providing read method)
  • conn_type (str) – connection type (“I”, “A”, “E”, “L”)
  • use_lines (bool) – use lines or block size for write
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — sended bytes to server.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
upload(source, destination='', *, write_into=False, callback=None, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

High level upload method for uploading files and directories recursively from file system.

Parameters:
  • source (str or pathlib.Path) – source path of file or directory on client side
  • destination (str or pathlib.Path) – destination path of file or directory on server side
  • write_into (bool) – write source into destination (if you want upload file and change it name, as well with directories)
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — sended bytes to server. This one should be used only for progress view, cause there is no information about which file this bytes really belongs.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
upload_file(destination, file, *, callback=None, block_size=8192)¶

asyncio.coroutine()

Low level upload method for uploading file from file-like object.

Parameters:
  • destination (str or pathlib.Path) – destination path of file or directory on server side
  • file – file-like object for reading data (providing read method)
  • callback (callable()) – callback function with one argument — sended bytes to server.
  • block_size (int) – block size for transaction
class aioftp.Code¶

Bases: str

Representation of server status code.

matches(mask)¶
Parameters:mask (str) – Template for comparision. If mask symbol is not digit then it passes.

Usage:

>>> Code("123").matches("1")
True
>>> Code("123").matches("1*3")
True
class aioftp.StatusCodeError(expected_codes, received_codes, info)¶

Raised for unexpected or “bad” status codes.

Parameters:
  • expected_codes (tuple of aioftp.Code or aioftp.Code) – tuple of expected codes or expected code
  • received_codes (tuple of aioftp.Code or aioftp.Code) – tuple of received codes or received code
  • info (list of str) – list of lines with server response

Usage:

>>> try:
...     # something with aioftp
... except StatusCodeError as e:
...     print(e.expected_codes, e.received_codes, e.info)
...     # analyze state

Exception members are tuples, even for one code.
